result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: 1651 W Jonquil Ter Apt 10, Chicago, IL 60626
Letter received from defendant - PER COURT, no action taken

Defendant Sheldon C Graham in court, in custody.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Sheldon C Graham.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance. Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Information.  Counsel argues for bond modification; State objects.  Court denies request and keeps bond as previously set.
Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Sheldon C Graham in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def indicates he spoke to SPD and they will be appointing counsel.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk BMC; Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sheldon C Graham appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa appeared by video for Sheldon C Graham. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Def requests Court Appointed Atty. Court appoints Atty Barbara Pierce.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $60.00 per month commencing 9-1-22. State requests $10,000 cash. Court orders $5,000 cash bond. Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Court vacates order for court appointed attorney. Advises Def to ask SPD to reevaluate. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
